relation: A reference to the Red Hat Storage server.
Defines a brick directory on the Red Hat Storage server.
Defines the file replication count for the brick in the volume.
Defines the stripe count for the brick in the volume
textBeforeTable: Table 10.6. Brick elements bricks sub-collection is defined using the following elements: bricks sub-collection to define individual bricks in a Red Hat Storage volume. Create a Red Hat Storage volume via a glustervolumes sub-collection as described in An API user manipulates the   </gluster_volume> </options> </option> <value>536870912</value> <name>cluster.min-free-disk</name> <option> <options> <stripe_count>1</stripe_count> <replica_count>2</replica_count> </transport_types> <transport_type>TCP</transport_type> <transport_types> <volume_type>DISTRIBUTED_REPLICATE</volume_type> /glustervolume/e199f877-900a-4e30-8114-8e3177f47651/bricks"/> href="/api/clusters/99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95 <link rel="bricks" <name>GlusterVolume1</name> /glustervolume/e199f877-900a-4e30-8114-8e3177f47651"> href="/api/clusters/99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95 <gluster_volume id="99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95"   Example 10.9. An XML representation of a Red Hat Storage volume
textAfterTable: An API user manipulates the glustervolumes sub-collection as described in Chapter 8, Common Features. Create new bricks via a POST request with the required server_id and brick_dir to the sub-collection. Example 10.12. Adding a brick  POST /api/clusters/99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95/glustervolumes/e199f877-900a-4e30-8114-8e3177f47651/bricks HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-Type: application/xml <brick> <server_id>server1</server_id> <brick_dir>/exp1</brick_dir> </brick> Remove a brick with a DELETE request. Example 10.13. Removing a brick  DELETE /api/clusters/99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95/glustervolumes/e199f877-900a-4e30-8114-8e3177f47651/bricks/0a473ebe-01d2-444d-8f58-f565a436b8eb HTTP/1.1 HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Important Resources in the bricks sub-collection cannot be updated. 10.2.2.  Start Action The start action makes a Gluster volume available for use. Example 10.14. Starting a Volume  POST /api/clusters/99408929-82cf-4dc7-a532-9d998063fa95/glustervolumes/e199f877-900a-4e30-8114-8e3177f47651/start HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-Type: application/xml <action/> Use an optional force Boolean element to force the action for a running volume. This is useful for starting disabled brick processes in a running volume. 10.2.3.  Stop Action The stop action deactivates a Gluster volume.
